required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Use of Alternative Therapy in Acne Vulgaris Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Use of Alternative Therapy in Acne Vulgaris Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Acne Vulgaris is a chronic skin disease. However, chronic and repetitive due to the quality of life and psychological status of patients can affect. Today, although the treatment is repetitive, chronic and requires follow-up due to the disease patients can turn to alternative and complementary medicine techniques. In recent years, studies on alternative medicine and complementary therapies have been noted in the medical literature. These studies also include Case Reports related to acne vulgaris. However, in our country, there is no study that tells us whether patients with acne vulgaris apply these treatments or not and what the practitioners think about the success of the treatment. The aim of the study will be to clarify issues such as whether patients with Acne Vulgaris apply alternative medicine and complementary therapies for their disease.

primary_outcome.description: Alternative medicine and complementary therapies that acne vulgaris patients apply without informing the doctor, how they learn these techniques, what make them use these techniques for their illness

intervention.description: Alternative medicine and complementary therapies that acne vulgaris patients apply without informing the doctor, how they learn these techniques, what make them use these techniques for their illness

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Acne vulgaris Patients between age 12-60
Exclusion Criteria:
- the ones who don't want to answer the questions
